column11: Review Text

column8: Moderate Hike to a Misty, Powerful Waterfall
column11: From the entrance, it‚Äôs about a 1.5 km walk to the waterfall observation deck. The path includes stairs and railings, but it‚Äôs a bit of a climb, so some level of fitness is needed. Tickets are required and the site is open from 6 AM to 6 PM. Reaching the base of the waterfall isn‚Äôt possible‚Äîor would be too dangerous‚Äîdue to the heavy water flow. It‚Äôs a unique waterfall with a powerful water mass and a constant misty atmosphere.
Really beautiful water fall in Sri Lanka. If you are in Ella or Badulla you should try visiting Dunhinda. Walking track is around 2km along one way. A great walk through the forest.

column8: How Local Government's Actions Detract from the Beauty of the Waterfall and Surroundings
column11: The waterfall and the walk to it are truly stunning. However, it's unfortunate that the local government has built small huts made of cadjan and sheet metal for local vendors, which detracts from the natural beauty of the area. I would advise not purchasing anything from these sellers, except for a bottle of water, as many of the products they offer are fake. For example, we were sold kitul jaggery, only to later discover that it was simply colored sugar pulp.

Beautiful place, too bad we saw it in the rain and the waterfall was mud colored!!! Very annoying is the fact that my Sri Lankan girlfriend paid 50 rupees while for us foreigners 500!!! In this country, this thing that happens in so many places is shameful!!!

Dunhida Falls is one of the most beautiful and most visited waterfalls in Sri Lanka . Located close to Badulla town and about 2km away from main road . It‚Äôs a lovely trek alone with some creaturous experience with monkeys . Fall is full these days with muddy and clear waters ‚Ä¶. One of most beautiful I have seen ‚ù§Ô∏è and excellent location for drone photography. Dr Piyal Kurukulasooriya Consultant Surgeon

Very beautiful waterfall. 30 - 45 minutes real trekking of 1.5 km in bushy jungle. Recommend to wear suitable footwear . On the way you meet lot of monkey s, looking for food. Several shops on the way selling local fresh fruits. The innocent female venders make their living out of it. Take some money with you , if you do not feel like buying something for you, feed innocent monkeys who are starving without food. Entrance fee for foreign tourists is similar to US$ 2.
Early morning mid week visit gave us a quiet time to explore this beautiful location. Worth the 1.5km of steps & rocks to the magnificent fall !

This is one of the most spectacular warerfalls in the country which is located in Badulla. Need to walk about 2km from the entrance to get to the location which will take about 20 - 30 mins depending on the speed. Truly a sight to see and a good location to capture some quality shots especially from a drone. Must visit sight in the island.
one of the best waterfall in Sri lanka .easy acces. Beautiful weather in area. If you need can have a bath. Very good spot for photos
it is a really nice walk through small pathway and reach to Dunhida fall. it is breath taking and iconic waterfall in Badulla. about 3 miles away from Badulla city. about 30 min walk to reach there

One of the beautiful waterfall in the universe. It's must visit place if you around. The place has developed for tourists. Easy access. About 1km need to walk to reach the observation deck. You can go down further. But should be watchful, it's so slepery. Be allert on monkeys. Don't bring foods that they can see. You need to pay a small to enter. Minimum 3 hours require.
Nice location... 45mins walk.. but totally worth. Better in weekdays .... there arw small shops where you can eat and drink something..

Dunhinda water fall situated around 5KM away from Badulla City. Water source is badulu oya river. Hight is 64 m but its one of the most beautiful water fall in srilanka. Meaning of the name ''Dunhinda" is misty water vapor.
It's not a walk in the park but there are a lot of spots where you can take a break and rest. It takes about 45 min to get to the waterfall but the view is worth the effort!

We went up with a guide called sudu. If you got 5 ‚Ç¨ it's more than worth it It takes around 45 exhausting minutes up to the top but you'll get a big reward when you did it. Sudu is always with you showing you the jumping spots and what's dangerous Was awesome!

If you are in Badulla or Ella area don't miss this. It is not a real easy hike but  many places to sit down so you can manage it. There are villagers selling souvenirs water and snacks on your walkway. The view of the waterfall is breathtaking. If you like you can go down to water from the view point. I did not see any one swimming.

Fantastic place to visit but be warned the walk is a bit precarious in places to say the least. Takes about 15 mins of walking up, down and around the edge of the valley wall until you get to the falls but well worth the effort to get there. Lots  of little shacks along the way selling drinks and food etc, recommend you stop on the way back for a freshly made mint sweet drink. 300 rupees entrance fee per person so just over ¬£1.30. Wasn‚Äôt too busy which was nice and amazing views. Hard going but well worth taking an hour of your time to view it. Lots of monkeys also there.
You have to walk close to 2 km to get to the fall, and its not a walk in the park, but their are couple of small shops you can rest and continue.

It‚Äôs a great spot to walk to, about a 1.7km stroll from the main road. It can be hard for some on the way back to the road. The path is strewn with so many shops selling food and drink items, and it‚Äôs such a sad thing to see that polythene and plastic is used for quite a lot of their products. The worst part is that you find plastic bottles and polythene bags along the path and even at the waterfall, thrown by unconcerned visitors and shop owners. The authorities need to pay more attention on this issue to preserve this beautiful spot! You can see monkeys and they mind their own business, as long as you don‚Äôt poke into theirs

Lovely waterfall, with a nice (if hot and sweaty) walk through the jungle. We went late in the day, so there were not too many people. However, the number of stalls packing up suggests that it would have been really busy earlier in the day.

Dunhinda Falls is a waterfall located about 5 kilometres from Badulla town. 64 m high. The way to Dunhinda falls is a bit hard. The view is really awesome. The best time to see them is June and July, but they're worth a visit at any time.

an unbelievable sight when one sees this at first. requires a walk of a thousand meters or bit more but its definitely worth it and the route adds to the beauty . Nice and genuine community of sellers at these wonderfully Srilankan village kiosks offering various types of low cost Srilankan food and drink is an experience in itself what with the more urban style commercialization of even distant places of Srilanka. Three wheeler price of 400 from Badulla Station is reasonable and the return to the bus stand is for 350. Where every prospect pleases the only MINUS is the trash left by the people ,particularly the plastic bottles along the route. If taken a closer look it would'nt be difficult to notice the heaps of plastic washed up the pool at the foot of the waterfalls.There is no point blaming it all on the authorities.Its our duty to bring our trash back HOME to be disposed correctly .Meanwhile it would be duty by out nation if we care to bring at least ONE BOTTLE left behind along the route by an irresponsible moron .Its our right to curse them but lets do something for the this natural wonder too..Our kids must see this in better state than what we see it today .

Once you're arrived to badulla, this is a main spot that everyone should visit. Just 10mins away from badulla town and visitors can have a little adventurous experience with the path way to waterfall. Earlier there were no steps there to reach to the waterfall but now a days it becomes easier to reach there with the newly built steps. So i recommend all my colleague to vist and get the best experience with this waterfall. It will be a such a experience to you all
amazing waterfall with nice green forest surrounding aria. falling water over 200 feet with misty climate

Have  no idea why they built steep steps.  They should add another step inbetween. Saw many people struggling along the way.  Years ago there were no steps and the hike was done very easily.  Don't know whoes bright idea it was to add cement steps which are not only hard but steep.

Just 5km from badulla city. Its 20LKR for locals and 200LKR for foriegners. Need to walk about 1km from the road but its really worth. All your tirdness goes when u  see the big waterfall. There are many local foodstalls throughout the tour with very low price..

To get to these Falls you have a 1.5 km trek from the road over roughing paths and quite a lot of steps, hence you need to be fairly fit. However, the walk is enjoyable with some good views and at some points lots of monkeys. Well worth a visit.
Nice waterfall with walking through the jungle, you can not swim here as the water flow is too big. it's beautiful surroundings and quite reasonable fee to go there

I personally prefer to get  up close and under the waterfall, said that this falls is not my favourite. The hike is quite long and the view point I jam-packed. Hiking down this waterfall was interesting as there were many snack and drink stalls set up on the hiking path until we reached the falls. The stalls looked like huts and had benches were you could take breaks on the way. Climbing back up was draining but thanks to the stalls for keeping us hydrated. The orange juice called ‚ÄúThodang‚Äù is a must have at this place as it was too good!

Beauty of Uva.. most beautiful waterfall in sri lanka..located about 5 kilometres (3.1 mi) from Badulla town. The waterfall, which is 64 metres (210 ft) high gets its name from the smoky dew drops spray, (Dun in sinhala means mist or smoke) which surrounds the area at the foot of the waterfall. It's also known as Bridal fall as the shape of the waterfall reflect a bridal veil. The water fall is created by the river called Badulu Oya which goes through the Badulla town.

This is one of the best waterfalls. Spectacular view even during the dry season with little water. The walk to it is bit hard, but well worthy. You also can see kuda Dunhinda (Small Dunhinha) along the way. Should rake time to climb down to the water pool.

Dunhinda Falls is a waterfall located about in Badulla town in Sri Lanka.The Dunhinda Falls is one of Sri Lanka's most beautiful waterfalls.If I am not mistaken this is the 2nd or 3rd tallest waterfall in Sri Lanka. It's also known as Bridal fall as the shape of the waterfall reflect a bridal veil. Must visit waterfall in Sri Lanka
It has large water reservoir  nice hike along the shady jungle enough refreshments along the walk you can bath in the river.
Absolutely wonderful view in front of the dunhida waterfall. But it was long walk to the waterfall it‚Äôs couple of hours walking!

Sri Lanka has a lot of waterfalls, most of them quite spectacular . Dunhinda falls. Is one of the better one. It might be the third biggest after Bamarakanda  and Diyaluma Water Falls, The waterfalls is a must see. It was mind blowing. One of the nicest views I've seen before. Entrance fee is Rs 200. From the main road (near Badulla , on Badulla Kandy- Mahiyanngana Road) you have to walk for couple of Km. These falls are about 5 km outside of Badulla and I would recommend to take a TukTuk to the falls. The track in is a steady 30 to 40 minutes with a lot of steps. The walk can be a bit tough in the heat slippery with rain, especially with little children, so some willingness to hike by them should be there. There are many rest stops along the way, some with vendors selling cool drinks etc. The walk to the waterfall is one of the memorable thing in our tour.  Monkeys will check if you have food. We traveled in the evening, the path was tough to walk.. Once you reach the waterfall, listen to the sound of water flowing after a tiresome walk and you get an amazing feeling. It is one of the best waterfall to view in Sri Lanka and very picturesque. Try this journey to the water fall from the road only if you are fit enough to walk,  The road leading to the water fall was extremely rough, slippery since it was raining. Coming back is no easier, but the falls make it all worthwhile. It is very interesting place to visit due to the location. You will dive pass most wonderful scenery and breathtaking views on the way in to the hill country and that will be the most beautiful part of your journey.  It is not recommend to-do any silly activities when the water level is high as it could be risky. It is a very beautiful water fall in Badulla, Sri Lanka. The waterfalls is a must see. It was mind blowing. One of the nicest views I've seen before. Overall it was a great experience. The large amount of monkeys begging for food & people who actually feed the animals so they come back again. We can see the fall from both front and top side also. But for view from top side you must go across Medapathana village. It is more of an adventures way. There were a few guide dogs that followed us to show us the way. Who are friendly, tame, very intelligent so caring and helpful and they stopped when we stopped. If anyone who reads this review is visiting this place. Carry some food for them like for about 4-5 dogs. Bread will be good too. I recommend you to visit the water fall.
The Falls are a fair walk from the road and depending on time of year can be quite crowded. But the view of the falls and the power of the falls is memorable.
safe and frequently used path . nearly 2 km through beautiful mountainous track . you will forget the distance once you reach there .

We stopped off to have a quick look at the waterfall on the way to Kandy from Ella. Was a fair old walk up and down, and very crowded when we got to the waterfall. Waterfall itself was nice but we couldn't see any way down to the water. Could just take photos from the view point. Would recommend if you have time (took us around 2hrs with a slower member in our group) and don't mind a bit of exercise, otherwise I think there are more beautiful waterfalls around Ella and further inland.
Little far from the road.but you will never worry about it after you seeing it.Do not miss this one!
Forget the distance that you have to walk near the fall. the sound of water falling down and beauty as a bridal veil give you an unforgettable experience.

Badulla town lies 3.5 km further down the Mahiyangana-Badulla Road. From the last point you need to walk approximately 1.2 km‚Äôs through a mountainous track to reach the waterfall. This is a safe and frequently used path due to the popularity of the fall.
If you love waterfalls, like I do and you are in Badulla, then by all means do not miss this one. take time to listen to the water falling down, take photos and admire the surroundings.
Dunhinda water fall is very beautiful  which reflects a bridal veil. As far as I am concerned  It is definitely worth the long walk  for the first timers.
You have to trek on a long hike to get to this water fall. A large mist rises because of the sheer drop. It a long walk but you'll be rewarded with the view.

A beautiful water fall along the badulla Mahiyangana road, we have go litle bit far by main stop lovely for photographs.. During the rainy season it is such a beautiful sight. One of the nicest water falls in Sri-Lanka.

Dunhinda waterfall call as Bridal fall as the shape of the waterfall reflect a bridal veil. This waterfall located round 5-6 km from Badulla town Sri Lanka. This is one of the most beautiful waterfall in Sri Lanka.
Dunhinda waterfall is situated in Badulla to Mahiyangana way in sri lanka. This is most famous water fall in sri lanka.

To view the waterfall, you must hike for at least an hour. It is not a natural path as there are concrete steps and small bridges and so on. But still quite challenging. Plenty of little shops on the way to buy water bottles and rest if needed. The waterfall can be viewed from a platform and it is very nice place to try visit if you are in the vicinity. Have to buy a ticket to enter, very cheap though.

Dunhinda falls is one of the most famous due to its beauty and the location in Sri Lanka. From the entrance to the water fall the path is properly developed with bridges and guard rails. Quite an easy hike but there are some places with steep steps so a baby stroller won't be a good idea. Do not try to feed the monkeys as they can become aggressive. Very relaxing and enjoyable hike through the forest to and amazing climax. Avoid climbing down to the river as it is very slippery and extremely dangerous and has claimed so many lives in the past. Respect nature..be quite and leave only your footsteps.

This is indeed a majestic waterfall which is located near Badulla town in SL. I am a resident of Badulla and I have been here many times. You have to walk nearly 2km from the main road along a foot path but nothing to worry. It's a perfectly safe walk. you can observe nature and some animals like monkeys. Along the road you can find small shops that sells snacks, toys, souvenirs and other herbal drinks and products. It's not the highest waterfall in SL but it's uniqueness attracts many locals and tourists. You can see it once you are there. It is most beautiful when there's more water in the rainy season. It's flow of water downwards creates a view of a long wale of a bride and a popular song is there for this (Google "Dunhinda Manamali"). High volume of water hitting the bottom creates a thick mist at the bottom of the waterfall which is a great view. You have to go and see that beauty. So don't miss it.

Reached this place after coming by train to badulla. From badulla railway station I came with getting a taxi.  This waterfall is located in Mahiyanganaya Badulla road. From Mahiyanganaya  Badulla road we had to walk 2km by walking pathway. Extremly very nice pathway. Please don‚Äôt bring polythene bags. Because they don‚Äôt let to get it towards falls. If you go in rainy season, you can see this fall very nicely. Nice place for photography. There is a viewing point. And if you go near falls please be careful because some deep places also there. Viewing point is so safe.

Hard work but completely worth it. We were there on a Sri Lankan holiday so it was very busy but almost entirely locals visiting. We also did the hike with 3 kids u derived 5. Lots of people helped us, even carried our three year old part of the way back up the hill. I would recommend this to anyone. Just make sure you take plenty of water, it was thirsty work. My oldest really loved this, more than the elephant safari.

A great walk down to the falls and very pretty falls when you get there. We were lucky enough to see monkeys while walking down and another troupe of monkeys crossing the fields at the falls. There are lots of stalls on the way down selling drinks and snacks, though when we visited (Monday morning) most of them were being closed and only one sold 'short eats' the rest sold packets of nuts, mango slices and drinks). The footpath is quite well built and fairly easy to walk up and down to the viewing area if you are in good health, the last bit of the walk from the viewing area to the pool around the falls is less well built and could be tricky in wet weather. The falls themselves are very nice, we sat for nearly an hour taking in the place and enjoying the tranquility. We only saw five other tourists when visiting so recommend visiting on a weekday morning. It is 200Rs entry fee (paid at a counter near the top) for foreign visitors, you can get to the falls using bus 314 from Badulla bus station (cost 20 Rs), other busses also stop at the falls but this is the one we got.

We have seen many waterfalls over the years in Sri Lanka, and this one, situated on the Mahiyangana Road is well worth visiting. It is one of the longest falls on the island being some 64 metres high. To reach the fall itself you have to walk along a muddy path for around 1-2km. There are kiosks to purchase drinks and snacks en route. It goes without saying that this place is best visited in the rainy season. We saw it recently at the end of the dry season and it was not so spectacular.
A beautiful creation of the nature. One of the longest and beautiful waterfalls in Badulla. Access route from the main road is little rough. But you wont feel tired.

~ Most beautiful waterfall I've ever seen & I've seen a lot. ~ You have to go through a 1Hr trail before visiting the waterfall. ~ There are small shops with drinks & fruits so you won't feel tired. ~ This trail is a fun one to take. ~ Beautiful forest with all kinds of trees. ~ Finally when you go near the waterfall you will know it's all worth the walk... ~ Must see in Srilanka

The entrance to the path leading to the waterfall is on the main road so a lot of people visit this waterfall even when they hadn't planned on visiting. The trek down the mountain is not difficult. People even carry their kids up and down. However, it's a long walk for about 2km. On both sides of the path there are local huts selling local food and herbal drinks for very cheap prices. The waterfall is beautiful. But I've heard it's loads prettier during the rainy season. I would recommend visiting during the rainy season.

Dunhinda falls is one of the beautiful waterfall in Sri Lanka. If you ever get a chance to visit the city of Badulla this is a place you must visit. The journey to the waterfall has to be done by foot. In the pathway you are in need to walk around 1- 1.5 KM to reach the waterfall, however walking that distance is pretty worthy for what you get at the end. There will be a ticketing counter to enter to the pathway which leads to the fall, and you are in need of paying a small amount to gain the access. The path is pretty much safe for anyone however there are several placed you need to be bit careful while walking. Along the way you will find small vendors selling stuff like tea/cool drinks/ snacks etc. As said before if you ever get a chance to visit Badulla city this a place you must visit.

dunhinda an amazing waterfall in srilanka.. its on mahejankana road nearly 6km from badulla town from entrance we have to walk through a path its amazing both side dense forest with endemic plants and animals from the beginning we can listen to the horror sound of water fall.. we can go near and watch the scenic beauty of water fall.. its like sparying if water... on that path through the water fall there a lots of stall where we can buy local tradition foods and drinks..we will get tired because its long and drough path.. but can enjoy the beauty nature...

To reach the waterfall you will have to walk close to one kilometer into the woods in a foot path from the main road.but you won't feel tired cos there are so many things to experience on your way .small boughtiques with Sri lankan food,herbal drinks , small souvenirs could see the real village life. It was a great experience ....
One of the most beautiful waterfall in Sri Lanka. About 1.5km from the main road. The road is a bit rough.
This is the most beautiful waterfall in Sri Lanka. Highly recommended to see this beautifull waterfall,
The amount of water in immense. It is misty around the fall. Absolutely wonderful scenery.  A must visit waterfall in Sri Lanka.
Nearly 2 Km away from Badulla Mahiyangana main road...You have to go on foot...The nature and adventure together..:)

Dunhinda (in Sinhala means spray) waterfall is located in the Mahigangana Road, Badulla.   To reach the water fall we walked more than 1.5 km from the entrance gate.  It a beautiful water fall.  If you visit to Badulla, you must see this beautiful waterfall.
Go to see Dunhinda falls was very interesting. we travelled  to badulla by train and next day morning we went to see dunhinda falls.

This is a very popular waterfall in Sri Lanka. The path to the waterfall is at the Thaldena (Badulla - Mahiyangana main road) which is at about 5km from Badulla. To reach the waterfall you have to walk about 1 km in a foot path from the main road. The water resource for this waterfall is called as Badulu Oya. When you will be walking in the foot path, there is another waterfall you can see in a little distance. That waterfall is called as Punchi Dunhinda. That waterfall is also a creation of a Badulu Oya.

Best place you can visit in Badulla/Ella area. It tooks more than 30 minutes climbing up to the hill but, once there. we experienced the best waterfall bath ever. 190 meter height gap folr this wonderful waterfall and you can lie in a natural swimming pool. Water is, obviously, cold but so relaxing and soothing from the hot temperature. People suggest you not to climb but it's not really difficult or unsafe (we did it with two young children) and you have to discover the uphill paradise where nobody is there.
Pls visit this place if you ever go passing Badulla and the view is amazing. You can bath down the river but not near the water fall as its too dangerous..

"Dunhinda" is one of the best waterfall in Sri Lanka. I have visit last week and it was my second time. Had to walk 1-2 km but once you reach to the dunhinda you start to feel the calmness and peacefullness. Really worth of been there. If you visit badulla you must go to watch this beautifull place

A drop of 210 feet from the 'Badulu Oya' (a stream), thick volume of water forming rainbows with the splashing spray, 5km from the Badulla town on the road to Mahiyangana and then on foot. When I last visited the falls about 50 years ago it was a less arduous walk as it was a well-traversed foot-path. 'Developers' have tried to make it easier by introducing stone steps in many places, with uneven height, making it all the more tiring.
Beauty of nature I have been there with my friends really fun place long walk like hill climb and also little dangerous placeüòÄüòú

It lies around 5 km away from Baddula and from the road side around 1.5 km walk. Since I was with parent, it was not possible to go closer due to hilly walk. We viewed it from distance and found very attractive. Nice fall though but not so high stream. Seems entire river is falling.

One of many most view waterfalls in Sri lanka. Little off the road, bit of trekking to get there and part of the fun is that. Along the way many small shops are there selling all sorts of foods and native herbal drinks. Takes about an hour to get there on foot from the initial entrance. Its mostly down hill going to it. Most vibrant during the rainy season.  I went about 4 years ago. Recommended for families. Also visitors should make sure no plastics or bottles are left behind, since it had been a problem in the past.
This is a massive waterfall to be seen. And the long walk to the waterfall will make you feel more interested about the seen. It is simply amazing.

Go in the day time: not early in the morning or later in the evening. Hard to  walk to and from the falls from the main road. One way journey is nearly 2.5km. Any way it is a good exercise. 'Dunhinda' as it's name implies generates a smoky & foggy and cloudy surrounding by smashing water on the stony grounds. Nice to look on for minutes. Remember to wear a cap when at falls.

The hike to Dunhinda falls is one I fully recommend. The hike is a pleasant one. The natural beauty is ruined by the numerous shops that are located along the path but they are helpful if you want to sit and catch your breath. The falls are an amazing sight, especially after heavy rain. Spending a few moments watching the water fall evokes emotions of awe at mother natures creations while also bringing a slight sense of fear when looking at the fury she can unleash.

You can take Dambulla-Mahinganaya bus from Dambulla (about 3km) then walk about 1 km in a surrounding full of trees. The view is amazing of waterfall and please don't try to swim there as it is dangerous. While your way back you can enjoy hot belimal from small shops near by.

Located near Badulla - Mahiyanganaya Road. There is an access road to the waterfall from main road. As I recalled it's about 4 Km. Dunhinda is one of beautiful waterfall I have seen in Sri Lanka. It's majestic. Water became mist and give you refreshing feeling. Check two view ports in the access road if you want to get clear distance shot of the waterfall.

yes,, your next trip ....plan will go to the babulla. and go and looking to the dunhinda falls.....this place to visit you can see the mist forming live  in the falls...I will  go to next time see the  dunhinda komali  in badulla....

The trail starting trough the food and local art and craft shops right next to the Badulla- Mahiyanganaya road (B 36). The foot path is around one mile from the entrance. It want be exhausting because of the tree canopy and the cold weather. That will lead to a most fascinating view of a waterfall. you can go down to the water stream and that is quite dangers. But there is a observation platform to watch and feel the mist of the Dunhinda water fall. It better to take some waterproof cover for your camera and other electronics because in the peek time the mist from the waterfall will almost cover entire place. This is a quite good place to visit If you are hanging around the island for at-least a month  or a extreme nature lover. There will be a small charge at the entrance.

This is one of  the most beautiful waterfall you will see in Sri Lanka. Its on Badulla - Mahiyangana Road. Can access the fall by public transport. You have to pay Rs200/- if you are a foreigner else Rs20/- for locals. You have to walk about 1km to reach the water fall and journey is not that  difficult since they have put up steps down the path. Avoid rainy days as with the wet conditions the steps can become slippery.

This place is is a wonderful place to visit you can see the the mist forming live in the falls it's a nice view and one thing to to tell please don't go down the to the rocks the water level rises up suddenly without warning
This is one of the most beautiful water fall I have seen. Need to walk about 1km on a off road. When raining it might be difficult to travel.

Took a ten minute bus ride to the entrance where foreigners  have to pay Rs 200/ (20/ for locals) to walk down the path ....mainly steps to a viewing area just above the falls. If you want to go right down to the water the path is not so well made and could be tricky in the rain. As for the falls themselves, yes they were worth the effort but not the most spectacular falls I`ve seen in Sri Lanka.

Dunhinda Falls is a waterfall located about 5 kilometres (3.1 mi) from Badulla town in Sri Lanka.The Dunhinda Falls is one of Sri Lanka's most beautiful waterfalls.The waterfall, which is 64 metres (210 ft) high gets its name from the smoky dew drops spray, (Dun in sinhala means mist or smoke) which surrounds the area at the foot of the waterfall. The water fall is created by the river called Badulu Oya which goes through the Badulla town. It is beautiful and serene.

The waterfall is beautiful and the walk to it is pleasant though lots of stairs in parts and some of them quite steep.  We went in the late afternoon between 4pm and  6pm when it was cooler and the sun was at the golden hour. There weren't many tourists, only one other couple. It was dry when we went so not slippery. Lovely,  though perhaps not comparable to other larger waterfalls else where,  but definitely worth the time and the walk.

Sri Lanka has a lot of waterfalls, most of them quite spectacular  . Dunhinda  falls. Is one of the better it might be the second biggest after Bamarakanda Falls The track in is a steady 30 to 40 minutes with a lot of steps.there are many rest stops along the way , some with vendors selling cool drinks etc. Coming back is no easier,but the falls make it all worthwhile .

The walk to the waterfall is one of the memorable thing in our tour. We traveled in the evening, the path was tough to walk, slippery. Once you reach the waterfall, listen to the sound of water flowing after a tiresome walk, was amazing feeling. It is one of the best waterfall to view is Sri Lanka and very picturesque.
Try this journer only if you are fit enough to walk, climb about 3kms.  I was very tired at the end.  The road leading to the water fall was extremely rough, slippery since it was raining.

This one of the biggest waterfalls in Sri Lanka which located in middle of the country. This is might not be the best waterfalls in the world if you have seen others all around the world. It is very interesting place to visit due to the location. You will dive pass most wonderful sceneries and breathtaking views on the way in to the hill country and that will be the most beautiful part of your journey. Not recommend to do any silly activities when the water level is high as it could be risky!!
Waterfall is not spectacular, but worth seeing. One mile enjoyable walk from the road. Monkeys will check if you have spare food.

There was a slight weather when I reached. We still went ahead. One old man told us he'd show us the way as it was getting dark. Helpful old man. It was about a 45 minute walk with steps and some hiking. Very tiring. Not advisable to go during rainy weather as it was quite dangerous. The waterfalls is a must see. It was mind blowing.  One of the nicest views I've seen before. THERE WERE A FEW GUIDE DOGS THAT FOLLOWED US TO SHOW US THE WAY. FRIENDLY TAME AND VERY INTELLIGENT. SO CARING AND HELPFUL, THEY STOPPED WHEN WE STOPPED. IF ANYONE WHO READS THIS REVIEW  IS VISITING THIS PLACE . CARRY SOME FOOD FOR THEM LIKE FOR ABOUT 4-5 DOGS.  BREAD WILL BE GOOD TOO. Overall it was a great experience.

These falls are about 5 km outside of Badulla and I would recommend to take a TukTuk to the falls. After some helpful people pointed us to the entrance towards the falls we started hiking. It took about 45 minutes to reach the waterfalls and during the walk you will also encounter a smaller fall (a bit further away). The walk can be a bit tough in the heat, especially with little children, so some willingness to hike should be there. What did annoy me was the large number of vendor stands you have to struggle through to reach the falls. The first two are fun to browse through, but the next 25 (with the same merchandise) are a nuisance, mainly because the owners keep offering you their goods. A second thing I did not like was the large amount of monkeys begging for food & people who actually feed the animals so they come back again. And finally, the large amounts of trash all along the trail and near the waterfall. It will be a matter of time before the fall itself will be full of trash. Perhaps the government who runs the maintenance of the falls can use the entrance fee they ask from tourists (which is ten times the local entrance fee!) to keep the place clean so tourists will come back. The positive thing about the falls is that it's a bit undiscovered by tourists. During our hike we did not encounter any tourist, which gives it the feeling of a local attraction, not completely spoiled.
We can see the fall from both front and top side also. But for view from top side you must go across medapathana village. Its an adventures way. You better try that also...

Well worth the trip to see this stunning waterfall. We took a tuk tuk from Badulla to the start of the trail. The walk was fine in the dry conditions and took around 30 minutes on a well trodden path. I think it'd be quite slippery after rain though! Entrance was 200rps and we had to let a local guy who just started walking with us know we didn't need his help. We came across a shady and slightly unhinged looking police officer on the way back, we couldn't understand what he was saying to us so just smiled and carried on and he left us alone

It is a very beautiful water fall in Badulla Sri Lanka. need to walk on a very adventurous stretch you can have lot of fun during walk. it is worth to watch the falls. you can rest and have a cool fresh orange juice on the go...
Much enjoyed the trail in the jungle and complemented to see this beautiful waterfall. On the way much enjoyed drinking local herbal tea (Belli Mal). Be careful about the monkeys!

Dunhinda water falls in Badulla is one of the most beautiful water falls in Sri Lanka. However the trek up to the falls through the forestry area is about 4 km of walking and a difficult one. The fall can be beautifully observed from a platform built right opposite the fall and during monsoons it falls at full ferocity with full of milky water. In the event you are interested to start this journey from Colombo or Kandy, the best scenic and convenient way is to get in to the intercity train. The train heading for Badulla passes,wet zones, mild hills, paddy fields  and plains up to Kadugannawa. From there the scenic beauty is excellent as the train traverse through tunnels, rocky crevices , steep climbs and you get the feeling of cod climatic changes ,passing Nawalapitiya,. Soon after passing Thalawakele, you can watch the "Devon falls and St Clair's falls on to your left side. Thereafter you pass the Upper Kotmale reservoir where the train does a very slow climb up to Nanuoya. Passing greener sheets of tea estates it passes "Demodara" railway station and peaks at "Pattipola" station where you are covered with clouds of mist. Passing Badarawela and Ella stations you ed your great train journey at Badulla, making you get ready for the final destination of watching Dunhinda falls.  This trip will give you an unforgettable memory not only about the beautiful Dunhinda falls but about the great train journey through the hills.

From the Badulla bus stand it cost Rs.300 to the falls. The walk through the woods among the small shops takes about 30-45 min. If females and single travelers wait for a crowd and do not go along when its dusk as the shops are closing up and you could face a difficulty slipping on the rocks or men who may try to keep abreast with you for no known reason. Always be safe than sorry.

One of the best places to see when you are in Badulla. If you are trying to visit go in the morning before the sun comes out.Do not try to have swim or to have a bath. It is very dangerous. the fall is really a beautiful water fall.
It is a highlight during your visit in Ella  .It is more than you would expect It is just around the corner of Ella tucked away in a beautiful area

I reached this waterfall very early in the morning. I was the only one to reach so early and had to walk alone. The walk is quiet slippery and I suggest you to wear good shoes. After I reached the waterfall, it was not so spectacular, but the sounds of the nature were very relaxing. I sat there for an hour and left. Even while leaving there were no one who visited the falls.

This beautiful waterfall is located about 5km from Badulla town.To reach the waterfall, we had to walk about more than 1km . This route was a foot path and little bit muddy (due to the rain the day before) and slippery , took us about 1 hour to reach the waterfall. Local ticket - Rs. 20 Foreign ticket - Rs.200 (April 2012)
Not the highest waterfall in Sri Lanka but the most powerful. It is in a jungle setting but is easily accessible.
